page.title: 01THE CEIRIOG VALLEY.
page.content: The Ceiriog Valley is on the south eastern side of the County of Clwyd.The valley consists of four villages, which are Pontfadog, Dolywern, Llwynmawr and Glyn Ceiriog.The main road follows the river up to Llanarmon .The river is called the River Ceiriog and it is one of the fastest flowing rivers in Wales. The valley is very steep sided with hardly any flat land. On the sides of the valley is land for grazing and on part of the southern side there is forestry commission land which is known locally as "Brown Billy".
